qas.question: What did radicals want to change the economy to?
What were they prepared to have happen to the Soviet Union in order to get a market economy?
Whose control were regional authorities hoping to do away with?

context: More radical reformists were increasingly convinced that a rapid transition to a <a0_0>market economy<a0_0/> was required, even if the eventual outcome meant the <a1_0>disintegration<a1_0/> of the Soviet Union into several independent states. Independence also accorded with Yeltsin's desires as president of <a2_0>the Russian Federation,<a2_0/> as well as those of regional and local authorities to get rid of <a3_0>Moscow’s<a3_0/> pervasive control. In contrast to the reformers' lukewarm response to the treaty, the conservatives, "patriots," and Russian nationalists of the USSR – still strong within the CPSU and the military – were opposed to weakening the Soviet state and its centralized power structure.
